is.iclt.icenlp.core.utils
Class Lexicon

java.lang.Object
  is.iclt.icenlp.core.utils.Lexicon
Direct Known Subclasses:
IceFrequency, Idioms
public class Lexicon
extends java.lang.Object

A class for storing and accessing a lexicon.

Field Summary
protected  PropertiesEncoding storage
          This class is based on the Lexicon class by Oliver Mason from the book Programming for Corpus Linguistics: How to Do Text Analysis with Java

This class is based on the Lexicon class by Oliver Mason from the book Programming for Corpus Linguistics: How to Do Text Analysis with Java

Constructor Detail

Lexicon

Constructor *

Lexicon

public Lexicon(java.io.InputStream in)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               java.lang.NullPointerException
Load a lexicon file. The lexicon is initialised from a file. The file should contain one line per entry, with the data separated from the entry with an equal-sign (the standard Java property format).

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.NullPointerException

lookup

public java.lang.String lookup(java.lang.String word,
                               boolean ignoreCase)
Look up a word in the lexicon. If the given word form is contained in the lexicon, the associated entry is returned as a String, otherwise null.
